text: - Hello, and welcome to Community Chats.
I'm Aley Hammer,
and today we're interviewing James Manner,
the co-founder of Pliny.
James, welcome to the show.
Can you start by telling our audience
a little bit about Pliny

and the problem that you're
solving for your customers?
- Thanks, Aley.

So Pliny is a cloud-based
image management system

for optometrists, ophthalmologists
and cardiologists.
Anyone of the viewers here

who have been to an
optometrist, an ophthalmologist,

will have had any number of
digital scans of their eyes.

And we are working to
make it easier and faster

for clinicians to view,
store, and manage those scans
so that they can spend more time
concentrating on their patients

and less time concentrating
on wrangling their computer
to find the correct scan
from the correct program and the like.

- What a convenient
service for your customers.

And James, why did you pick
AWS as your cloud provider?

- I've been working with
AWS for the best part
of five, nearly six years.
So,
we initially used AWS

because of the familiarity
with their services,
but the reality is the service profile,

the different services such as
AppSync and S3 that AWS have,

really match well with what
we're trying to build with Pliny
in terms of mass cloud storage.

You know, for instance, our
customers have terabytes of data

and S3 allows us to scale and
securely store all of that.
So the service offering from AWS

really closely aligns
with what our product is,

and being able to abstract
the heavy lifting for-
The heavy lifting of that technology

allows us to concentrate
on building things
that our customers need
and not on the infrastructure
and the non-visible
features of our product.
- Absolutely, thanks for sharing.
And James, can you share some insights

into how your technology
benefits your customers?
And what I want to know is,
where does AWS fit in with this?
Because I think you referenced that
you've had some awesome credits
that you passed on to your customers.

- At the end of the day,
one of the core benefits

shifting to the cloud is
just removing the headache

of managing the IT
infrastructure for our customers.
So you mentioned the Credits Program,
one of our major customers
we are able to save them the first year
in nearly $40,000

by removing the need for them
to upgrade their services
across our eight different sites,

servers across their
eight different sites,
sorry, that is.
And as part of the Credits Program,
we, Pliny, were able to offer our customer
two years free cloud hosting as well.
So the Credits Program that AWS provided,

we were able to in turn
pass that onto our customer.
And that was really critical
to us onboarding our first large customer,
and demonstrating that
we really did have a product

and that it was gonna be a
real benefit to our customers.
So it was really important.

So the AWS Credits Program
is really important to us.
It was really important to our customer,

'cause our customer was a
public health organization
who, when COVID, were dramatically hit
by a reduction in revenue.
And it was a win-win for everybody.

- Wow, I'm sure your
customer was so pleased

when they were able to obtain
two years free hosting.
That's huge.
And James, to round off this interview,
what are your future plans for Pliny?
- Oh, (chuckling) world domination.

No. No, that's probably
a little bit grand.
No, look,
we are concentrating on being able

to increase our customer
base at the moment.

That's our number one
priority at the moment.

We've working on sort of
two steps for future growth.

So number one is to allow
digital collaboration,
digital sharing of these raw scans,
to be able to move beyond
sending and exchanging faxes,

which is pretty common in
the healthcare industry,
and, at best, maybe a PDF,

to be able to exchange and
collaborate on the raw scans,

opening up telehealth
for ocular and cardiology
which previously hasn't been available.
So that's sort of our next goal.
And then our third goal is,

being able to integrate
AI analysis into Pliny

that allows clinicians to be
able to have diagnostic aids

where images and scans
are automatically graded

and flagged as a risk
for various diseases.

So that's a massive
benefit for our customers,
being clinicians.
It's a risk management tool
so that they can ensure that every image
has a second set of eyes,
excuse the pun, cast over them,
and
minimizing the likelihood
that they're gonna miss any conditions

or anything that needs to
get reviewed by themselves
or referred onto other providers.

- Well, you're doing such
fantastic work over at Pliny

and we're so thrilled to
partner with you, James.

Thank you so much for
coming on the show today.
And if anyone has any questions,

please pop them in the
comment section below
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you so much, James.
- Thanks Aley. Have a great day.
- You too.
